first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles
first_reading.text:
[[Ac 2,14]]Then Peter stood up with the Eleven,  raised his voice, and proclaimed:  "You who are Jews, indeed all of you staying in Jerusalem.  Let this be known to you, and listen to my words.
[[Ac 2,22]]You who are Israelites, hear these words. Jesus the Nazorean was a man commended to you by God with mighty deeds, wonders, and signs, which God worked through him in your midst, as you yourselves know.
[[Ac 2,23]]This man, delivered up by the set plan and foreknowledge of God, you killed, using lawless men to crucify him.
[[Ac 2,24]]But God raised him up, releasing him from the throes of death, because it was impossible for him to be held by it.
[[Ac 2,25]]For David says of him: 'I saw the Lord ever before me, with him at my right hand I shall not be disturbed.
[[Ac 2,26]]Therefore my heart has been glad and my tongue has exulted; my flesh, too, will dwell in hope,
[[Ac 2,27]]because you will not abandon my soul to the netherworld, nor will you suffer your holy one to see corruption.
[[Ac 2,28]]You have made known to me the paths of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence.'
[[Ac 2,29]]My brothers, one can confidently say to you about the patriarch David that he died and was buried, and his tomb is in our midst to this day.
[[Ac 2,30]]But since he was a prophet and knew that God had sworn an oath to him that he would set one of his descendants upon his throne,
[[Ac 2,31]]he foresaw and spoke of the resurrection of the Messiah, that neither was he abandoned to the netherworld nor did his flesh see corruption.
[[Ac 2,32]]God raised this Jesus; of this we are all witnesses.
[[Ac 2,33]]Exalted at the right hand of God, he received the promise of the holy Spirit from the Father and poured it forth, as you (both) see and hear.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 28,8]]Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went away quickly from the tomb,  fearful yet overjoyed,  and ran to announce the news to his disciples.
[[Mt 28,9]]And behold, Jesus met them on their way and greeted them. They approached, embraced his feet, and did him homage.
[[Mt 28,10]]Then Jesus said to them, "Do not be afraid. Go tell my brothers to go to Galilee, and there they will see me."
[[Mt 28,11]]While they were going, some of the guard went into the city and told the chief priests all that had happened.
[[Mt 28,12]]They assembled with the elders and took counsel; then they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers,
[[Mt 28,13]]telling them, "You are to say, 'His disciples came by night and stole him while we were asleep.'
[[Mt 28,14]]And if this gets to the ears of the governor, we will satisfy (him) and keep you out of trouble."
[[Mt 28,15]]The soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story has circulated among the Jews to the present (day).

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 16,1]]Keep me, O God, for in you I take refuge;
[[Ps 16,2a]]I say to the LORD, "My Lord are you."
[[Ps 16,5]]O LORD, my allotted portion and my cup, 
you it is who hold fast my lot.

[[Ps 16,7]]I bless the LORD who counsels me; 
even in the night my heart exhorts me.
[[Ps 16,8]]I set the LORD ever before me; 
with him at my right hand I shall not be disturbed.

[[Ps 16,9]]Therefore my heart is glad and my soul rejoices, 
my body, too, abides in confidence
[[Ps 16,10]]because you will not abandon my soul to the netherworld, 
nor will you suffer your faithful one to undergo corruption.

[[Ps 16,11]]You will show me the path to life, 
fullness of joys in your presence, 
the delights at your right hand forever.
